</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.32
<SEQUENCE>12
<FILENAME>a2126594zex-10_32.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-10.32
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>

</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#04ATA1030_11">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ja1031_exhibit_10.32"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ja1031_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 10.32    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ja1031_consulting_agreement"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ja1031_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>CONSULTING AGREEMENT    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THIS CONSULTING AGREEMENT (referred to as "Agreement") made and entered into this 1<SUP>st</SUP> day of August, 2003 by and between The Coca-Cola
Company, a Delaware corporation ("Company") and Chatham International Corporation ("Consultant"). </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>WITNESSETH: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>WHEREAS</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, Consultant desires to perform consulting services for Company, on the terms and conditions hereinafter set forth. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><B>NOW, THEREFORE</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>, in consideration of the premises and the mutual promises and agreement contained herein, the parties hereto, intending to
be legally bound, hereby agree as follows: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Consultant Undertakings</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Consultant,
by the services of Brian&nbsp;G. Dyson, shall provide consultation to management of Company from time to time as requested by Company's Chairman and Chief
Executive Officer (Douglas&nbsp;N. Daft) or his designees. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Such
consultation shall include, without limitation, involvement with Company business plans, bottlers and joint ventures. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Consulting Fees and Expenses</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
full and total compensation for services by Consultant under and during the term of this Agreement, Company shall pay to Consultant $16,666.67 per month. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Company
shall reimburse Consultant for expenses he may reasonably incur in connection with his performance hereunder provided such expenses are not reimbursed elsewhere
and that all such expenses shall be approved in writing by Company's Office of the Chairman. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Consultant
shall also be eligible for discretionary and periodic performance bonuses for exceptional service against specified tasks. Such discretionary bonus shall be
determined by the CEO in consultation with the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Term</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This
Agreement shall commence on September&nbsp;1, 2003 and shall expire on August&nbsp;31, 2004. This Agreement may be extended by the mutual written agreement of
Company and Consultant. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Intellectual Property</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
this Agreement, "Intellectual Property" means all works, including literary works, pictorial, graphic and sculptural works, architectural works, works of visual art,
and any other work that may be the subject matter of copyright protection; advertising and marketing concepts; information; data; formulas; designs; models; drawings; computer programs; including all
documentation, related listings, design specifications, and flowcharts, trade secrets, and any inventions including all processes, machines, manufactures and compositions of matter and any other
invention that may be the subject matter of patent protection; and all statutory protection obtained or obtainable thereon. Consultant hereby assigns to Company all worldwide right, title and interest
in and to Intellectual Property created, made, conceived, reduced to practice or authored by Consultant, or any persons provided by Consultant either solely or jointly with others, during the
performance of this Agreement or with the use of information, materials or facilities of Company received by Consultant during the term of this Agreement. Company shall be free to make, have made, use
and sell products utilizing the Intellectual Property assigned to Company. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.2&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Consultant
shall promptly disclose to Company all Intellectual Property created by Consultant during the term of this Agreement. </FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2126594",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="11",CHK=705618,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK032:[04ATA1.04ATA1031]JA1031A.;1',USER='CHANSON',CD='20-FEB-2004;19:55' -->
<A NAME="page_ja1031_1_2"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.3&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Consultant
shall execute or cause to be executed, all documents and perform such acts as may be necessary, useful or convenient to secure for Company statutory
protection including patent, trademark, trade secret or copyright protection throughout the world for all Intellectual Property assigned to Company pursuant to this Section. In addition, any
Intellectual Property which qualifies as a work made for hire under the U.S. Copyright laws shall be a work made for hire and shall be owned by Company. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.4&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Consultant
shall retain ownership of all Intellectual Property clearly documented as having been made solely by Consultant prior to the date of this Agreement and
expressly excluded from this Agreement in an attachment hereto. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Confidentiality</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;It
is presumed that Company has disclosed or may disclose to Consultant or Consultant may come in contact with or observe business information, know-how,
marketing plans, trade secrets, inventions, and other intellectual property rights (all which are hereinafter jointly referred to as "Proprietary Information") that are either the property of Company
or controlled by Company. Such Proprietary Information must be held in strict confidence by Consultant and must not be used or disclosed to any third party without the express prior written permission
of an officer of Company. Consultant must safeguard all written materials that Company supplies to Consultant, must not copy or duplicate such materials without Company's prior written consent, and
must return such materials to Company upon the completion of services hereunder or upon Company's request. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>6.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Limitations</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
the duration of this Agreement, and for a period of two years thereafter, Consultant must not, without the prior written consent of Company, render services to any
other firm, corporation, or individual engaged in a business competitive with that of Company. Any such performance constitutes a material breach of this Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>7.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Miscellaneous</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.1</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Independent Consultant.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Consultant is and will remain an independent consultant and not an employee of
Company and has no authority to bind Company in any way. It is expressly understood that this undertaking does not constitute a joint venture. Consultant agrees that it shall have exclusive control
and direction of those persons engaged in performing the services provided for hereunder, and neither Consultant nor any of its employees or subconsultants shall be deemed to be employees of Company.
Consultant agrees to assume full responsibility for the payment of all local, state and federal payroll and withholding taxes or contributions or taxes for unemployment insurance, pension, worker's
compensation, or other social security or related protection with respect to those persons engaged in the performance of services in connection with this Agreement. Consultant further understands that
Consultant is entitled to no other benefits hereunder except that compensation set forth in Section&nbsp;2 above. It is understood that Consultant will not be required to work scheduled hours and
Consultant may perform the services at those locations that Consultant deems appropriate to fulfill Consultant's obligations under this Agreement. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.2</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Use of Company's Name.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Consultant must not, without Company's prior written approval, publish or use any
advertising, sales promotion or publicity relating to services, reports and materials furnished by Consultant in which the name of Company is mentioned or its identity implied. In addition, Consultant
agrees that it will not use Company's name in poor taste or in a disparaging manner. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.3</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Governing Law.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Agreement shall be subject to the laws of the State of Georgia, and the parties agree
all disputes arising from or related to this Agreement shall be litigated in the state or federal courts located in Fulton County, Georgia. The parties agree that such courts shall be the </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2126594",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="11",CHK=899093,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK032:[04ATA1.04ATA1031]JA1031A.;1',USER='CHANSON',CD='20-FEB-2004;19:55' -->
<A NAME="page_ja1031_1_3"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>exclusive
forums for such disputes and hereby submit to the jurisdiction and venue of such courts for the litigation of all such disputes. The parties hereby waive any claims of improper venue or lack
of personal or subject matter jurisdiction as to any such disputes. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.4</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Waivers.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All waivers of a breach or violation of this Agreement by either party must be in writing and
cannot operate as, or be construed to be, a waiver of subsequent breach hereof. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.5</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Warranties.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Consultant certifies and warrants that: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(1)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Consultant
has the experience and ability necessary to perform all services required by this Agreement.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(2)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Consultant
has full power and authority to enter into and fully perform this Agreement, and no services, equipment, materials or reports furnished hereunder will in any way infringe
upon or violate the rights of any third person, including, without limitation, rights of patent, trade secret, trademark or copyright. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.6</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Code of Business Conduct.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Consultant acknowledges receipt by him of a copy of the Code of Business Conduct
of The Coca-Cola Company, and agrees to be bound by its provisions. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>8.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notices</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Unless
otherwise provided for herein, all notices required or permitted hereunder shall be in writing and delivered to the respective parties at the addresses set forth
below (or to such other addresses as either party may provide to the other party in accordance herewith), by hand delivery, by certified mail, return receipt requested, postage prepaid or by telegram,
telex or telecopy, charges prepaid and shall be deemed served upon the date of deposit in the mail or at a telegraph office or upon the date of delivery if delivered by hand or by telex or telecopy: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>If
to The Coca-Cola Company, addressed to: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
Coca-Cola Company<BR>
P.O. Drawer 1734<BR>
Atlanta, Georgia 30301<BR>
Attention: Office of the Chairman </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>If
to Consultant, addressed to: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Mr.&nbsp;Brian
G. Dyson<BR>
[address intentionally deleted] </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>9.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Entire Agreement</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This
Agreement embodies the full and complete understanding of the parties hereto and supersedes any previous agreement, written or oral, relating to the subject matter
hereof. The parties may modify this Agreement only by written instrument signed by each of the parties hereto. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>10.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Captions</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
captions used in this Agreement are for convenience only and cannot affect in any way the meaning or interpretation of any of the provisions set forth herein. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>3</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=3,EFW="2126594",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="11",CHK=865284,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK032:[04ATA1.04ATA1031]JA1031A.;1',USER='CHANSON',CD='20-FEB-2004;19:55' -->
<A NAME="page_ja1031_1_4"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>11.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Survival</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;11.1&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sections&nbsp;4,
5, 6 and 7 shall survive expiration or termination of this Agreement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, Company and Consultant have executed this Agreement under seal as of the date first above written. </FONT></P>

&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD WIDTH="6%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>

<TD WIDTH="44%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>

<TD WIDTH="47%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="jq1031_exhibit_10.33.1"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_jq1031_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit 10.33.1    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=4><B>THE COCA-COLA COMPANY BENEFITS PLAN<BR>
FOR MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=4><B> Effective December&nbsp;31, 2002  </B></FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2126594",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="12",CHK=806333,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK032:[04ATA1.04ATA1031]JQ1031A.;3',USER='CHANSON',CD='20-FEB-2004;19:59' -->
<A NAME="page_jq1031_1_1"> </A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=4><B> <A NAME="jq1031_article_i_purpose_of_plan"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_jq1031_2"> </A>
<BR>    </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>ARTICLE I<BR>  PURPOSE OF PLAN    <BR>    </I></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective December&nbsp;31, 2002, The Coca-Cola Company adopted The Coca-Cola Company Benefits Plan for Members of the Board of
Directors (the "Plan"). The purpose of the Plan is to provide certain individuals certain welfare benefits described in this Plan, in the Summary Plan Description (as amended, renamed, and/or
replaced) for active employees, any summaries of material modification ("SMMs") issued with respect thereto (the SPD and any subsequent SMMs&nbsp;collectively shall be referred to herein as the
"SPD"), and in any other applicable certificates of insurance coverage. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
SPD is attached hereto as Appendix&nbsp;B and is hereby incorporated by reference with those portions describing employee welfare benefits constituting a part of this Plan, except
as set forth in a separate written plan document. The employee welfare benefits that are part of this Plan are identified in Appendix&nbsp;A of this Plan. Different versions of the SPD may apply to
different classifications of individuals. In such case, the version(s) of the SPD applicable to such classification(s) of Eligible Individuals shall control. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="jq1031_article_ii_definitions"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_jq1031_3"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>ARTICLE II<BR>  DEFINITIONS    <BR>    </I></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as otherwise provided in the SPD, the following terms shall have the following meanings: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"Benefits"</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the various welfare benefits made available to Eligible Individuals and their Dependents hereunder, as set forth in
Appendix&nbsp;A. The component Benefits are described in more detail in the SPD. The manner by which such Benefits are provided, e.g., insured, self-funded, etc., and the entity(ies)
responsible for Benefit administration are set forth in the SPD and any applicable certificates of insurance coverage. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"Board"</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the Company's Board of Directors. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"Committee"</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> shall mean the Benefits Committee appointed by the Senior Vice President, Human Resources to administer the Plan as provided
in Article&nbsp;VII. This term is interchangeable with "Plan Administrator." </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"Company"</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means The Coca-Cola Company. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"Covered Dependent"</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means each of the Dependents whom a Participant has elected to cover under the Plan as his or her Dependent. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"Covered Person(s)"</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means a Participant and/or his Covered Dependents, whichever is applicable. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"Dependent"</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means those eligible Dependents described in the plan documents for the component Benefits or in the SPD. The definition of
eligible Dependent may vary for purposes of the component Benefits, and the definition contained in each Benefit description shall control. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"Effective Date"</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the effective date of this Plan document, December&nbsp;31, 2002. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"Eligible Individual"</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means an active or former member of the Board who is not an employee of the Company. As may be indicated in the SPD
or Appendix&nbsp;A, different Eligible Individuals (e.g., active members or former members) may be eligible for different Benefit options. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"Enrollment Period"</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the enrollment period designated by the Plan Administrator each Plan Year (as set forth in the annual enrollment
materials) during which Participants make their Benefit elections for the succeeding Plan Year. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>1</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2126594",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="12",CHK=931352,FOLIO='1',FILE='DISK032:[04ATA1.04ATA1031]JQ1031A.;3',USER='CHANSON',CD='20-FEB-2004;19:59' -->
<A NAME="page_jq1031_1_2"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"Participant"</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means an Eligible Individual who is deemed to have completed the election procedures set forth in the SPD. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"Plan Year"</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> means the 12-month period beginning January&nbsp;1 and ending on the subsequent December&nbsp;31, or if
shorter, such portion of a calendar year beginning with the date an individual becomes a Participant under this Plan and ending on December&nbsp;31, or if earlier, the date when a Participant's
coverage would otherwise end. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="jq1031_article_iii_eligibility_and_participation"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_jq1031_4"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>ARTICLE III<BR>  ELIGIBILITY AND PARTICIPATION    <BR>    </I></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as otherwise provided in the SPD, the following provisions shall govern eligibility and participation: </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.01</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Individual's Commencement of Participation.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Each Eligible Individual and Dependent shall be eligible to
participate in the Plan under the terms and conditions specified in the SPD. Each Eligible Individual who is deemed to have completed the enrollment and election procedures described in the SPD may
become a Participant on the date specified therein. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.02</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Covered Dependent's Commencement of Participation.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as otherwise provided in the SPD, coverage with
respect to a Covered Dependent will begin on the same date that coverage begins for the Participant who elects such Dependent coverage. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.03</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cessation of Participation.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A Participant will cease to be a Covered Person, and all Benefit coverage with
respect to the Participant and his or her Covered Dependents will end, as of the earliest of: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>the
date of the Plan's termination;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>the
date on which the Covered Person's coverage is canceled by reason of his or her failure to make timely payment of his share of the cost of Benefit coverage, if applicable;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>the
date on which the Participant ceases to be an Eligible Individual;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(d)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>with
respect to coverage of a Covered Dependent, the date on which the Dependent loses eligibility because he or she no longer qualifies as a Dependent under the Plan. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="jq1031_article_iv_election_procedures"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_jq1031_5"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>ARTICLE IV<BR>  ELECTION PROCEDURES    <BR>    </I></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as otherwise provided in the SPD, the following provisions shall govern Plan elections: </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.01</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Election Procedures.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Eligible
Individuals shall be provided with sufficient information by which each Eligible Individual may elect Benefits for the upcoming Plan Year. Enrollment in the Plan for the Plan
Year may be accomplished by either completion of designated written enrollment and election forms or utilization of a voice response unit or other comparable electronic communications device, or other
reasonable procedure as the Plan Administrator shall designate. If enrollment is accomplished by means of a voice response unit, the Participant shall receive written confirmation of his or her
Benefit election. The Participant's enrollment and Benefit election shall be effective as of the first day of the upcoming Plan Year and must be completed on or before such date as the Plan
Administrator shall specify.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Unless
otherwise provided in the SPD, if an individual becomes an Eligible Individual between annual Enrollment Periods, the Eligible Individual may enroll in the Plan as specified in
the SPD. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=3,EFW="2126594",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="12",CHK=118711,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK032:[04ATA1.04ATA1031]JQ1031A.;3',USER='CHANSON',CD='20-FEB-2004;19:59' -->
<A NAME="page_jq1031_1_3"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Each
Benefit election shall remain effective throughout the Plan Year unless revoked or suspended in accordance with Section&nbsp;4.02 of this Plan.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(d)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Any
Eligible Individual who fails to make a timely election after his or her initial Plan Year shall be deemed to have elected to continue the same Benefits and coverages then in
effect for such Eligible Individual. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.02</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Revocation and Modification of Elections.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
Plan Administrator may establish procedures by which a Participant may modify Benefit elections prior to the end of a Plan Year.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Any
modification of an election under this Section shall be accompanied by the Participant's execution of a revised election form or other method established by the Plan Administrator
and shall be effective at such time as the Plan Administrator shall prescribe. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="jq1031_article_v_benefits_and_claims"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_jq1031_6"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>ARTICLE V<BR>  BENEFITS AND CLAIMS    <BR>    </I></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as otherwise provided in the SPD, the following provisions shall govern Plan Benefits: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.01</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Benefits Available.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Benefits which a Participant may elect shall be subject to any additional
limitations or restrictions set forth in the coverage documents for each such Benefit as described in the SPD. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.02</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Provision of Benefits.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company shall provide the Benefits the Participant has elected under the Plan,
in accordance with the terms of such Benefits as described in the SPD, in any other applicable program, contract or document, and in accordance with any conditions or restrictions imposed by an
insurance company providing any Benefit. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.03</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Insurance Contracts.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Some or all of the Benefits provided under the Plan may, at the discretion of the
Company, be provided by the purchase of insurance contracts, as described in the SPD. Any dividends, retroactive rebates, or other refunds or credits which may become payable under any insurance or
health care service contracts or benefit programs shall be the property of and retained by the Company. To the extent there is any conflict between the terms of this Plan or the SPD and the insurance
documents, the insurance documents shall govern. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.04</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Benefit Costs.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company shall, from time to time, evaluate the funding method for the Plan. The amount
of Participant contributions, if any, and the method for payment of Participant contributions will be determined by the Company and disclosed to Participants in annual enrollment information. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.05</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Claims.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as otherwise provided in the SPD: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Claims
payments with respect to Benefits under this Plan shall be made only with respect to claims or expenses incurred on and after the date an individual first becomes a Covered
Person hereunder, and before the date participation ceases under Section&nbsp;3.3. A claim or expense with respect to a Benefit shall be deemed to be incurred when the Covered Person is provided
with the service which gives rise to the expense, not when the Covered Person is billed or charged for the service.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>All
claims for benefits under the Plan shall be made, processed and paid in accordance with the terms and conditions of the SPD and applicable program, insurance contract or other
document that sets forth the terms of such Benefit. With respect to any self-funded Benefits provided under this Plan, a Covered Person's failure to cash a Benefit check within twelve
months of issuance of such payment shall result in a forfeiture of such payment to the Plan. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>3</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=4,EFW="2126594",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="12",CHK=336452,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK032:[04ATA1.04ATA1031]JQ1031A.;3',USER='CHANSON',CD='20-FEB-2004;19:59' -->
<A NAME="page_jq1031_1_4"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>
</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>A
Covered Person or other claimant shall be entitled to reimbursement or payment only if he (or his estate) applies for such reimbursement or payment on or before the date which is
twelve months following the date the claim with respect to such Benefit was incurred.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(d)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Any
suit for Benefits must be brought within twelve months after the date the Plan Administrator (or his designee) has made a final denial (or deemed denial) of the claim.
Notwithstanding any other provision herein, any suit for Benefits must be brought within two years after the date the claim for Benefits first arose. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.06</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Claims Procedure and Appeal of Benefit Denials.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The process by which a claim for benefits shall be handled
by the Plan Administrator and the process by which a Participant may appeal the denial of a claim for benefits are set forth in the SPD and incorporated herein by reference. As set forth in the SPD,
insurance carriers (and other entities) may serve as the claims fiduciary with regard to certain Benefits. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.07</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Coordination of Benefits with Other Plans.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As set forth in the SPD, in the event that a Covered Person is
entitled to any benefits from another plan or policy, Benefits under this Plan may be reduced to an amount, which together with all other amounts paid under any other plan or policy, will not exceed
the Benefits that would in fact be eligible for reimbursement under this Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
a Covered Person is eligible for Medicare, Medicare will be primary to the extent permitted under applicable law&#151;for example if a Covered Person receives Plan Benefits
other than by virtue of current employment status. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.08</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Reimbursement Agreement, Subrogation.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>As
described in the SPD, if a Covered Person receives or becomes eligible to receive any dental, medical, vision and/or disability Benefit or other Benefit ("Reimbursable Benefit")
arising from an accident, injury or illness for which the Covered Person has, may have, or has asserted any claim or rights to recovery against a third party or parties, then any payments by this Plan
with respect to such Reimbursable Benefit shall be made on the condition that this Plan will be reimbursed by the Covered Person, to the extent of any amount or amounts received or receivable from or
with respect to the third party or parties, whether by way of suit, judgment, settlement, compromise or otherwise and without regard to how the amount received from the third party or parties is
characterized.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
"make whole doctrine" arising under federal common law and under state law does not apply to the Plan's reimbursement or subrogation rights. The Plan retains its reimbursement and
subrogation rights described herein regardless of whether the Covered Person's receipt of payment from other sources fully reimburses the Covered Person or whether the Covered Person has been "made
whole," (i.e., the Plan has the right of first reimbursement, even if the Covered Person is not fully compensated for his injury). The Plan's right of recovery applies to the full amount the Covered
Person receives (unreduced by attorney's fees and other expenses). The Plan does not share the Covered Person's cost of recovery.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>To
the extent set forth in the SPD, the Covered Person may be obligated to sign a reimbursement agreement, as prescribed by the Plan Administrator, before any Reimbursable Benefits
are paid from this Plan. If Reimbursable Benefits are to be paid with respect to an Covered Dependent who is a minor, the Plan Administrator may require the Participant to execute a reimbursement
agreement on the minor's behalf. All Covered Persons shall be obligated to cooperate with this Plan in its efforts to enforce its reimbursement rights and to refrain from any actions that interfere
with those rights. The Plan shall have the right to take all appropriate actions necessary to enforce its reimbursement rights in the event that a Covered Person refuses to sign a reimbursement
agreement, refuses to reimburse this Plan in accordance with the Plan's reimbursement rights, or takes any other action inconsistent with </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>4</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=5,EFW="2126594",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="12",CHK=566035,FOLIO='4',FILE='DISK032:[04ATA1.04ATA1031]JQ1031A.;3',USER='CHANSON',CD='20-FEB-2004;19:59' -->
<A NAME="page_jq1031_1_5"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>the
Plan's reimbursement rights. In such situations, the Plan's options shall include, without limitation, the right in appropriate cases to deny Benefits to an individual who refuses to sign a
reimbursement agreement, to institute legal actions to recover sums wrongfully withheld or to obtain other relief, and/or to offset wrongfully withheld sums against future Benefit payments otherwise
owed the Covered Person. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(d)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
Plan shall be subrogated to all claims, demands, actions and rights of recovery of the Covered Person against a third party or parties to the extent of any and all payments made
by the Plan with respect to Reimbursable Benefits, and the reimbursement agreement shall so provide. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="jq1031_article_vi_amendment_and_termination_of_plan"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_jq1031_7"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>ARTICLE VI<BR>  AMENDMENT AND TERMINATION OF PLAN    <BR>    </I></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.01</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amendment of Plan.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Committee reserves the right to amend the provisions of the Plan to any extent and
in any manner it desires by execution of a written document describing the intended amendment(s). The Committee may amend the SPD(s) attached hereto at any time by preparation and publication of a
revised SPD (or SMM). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.02</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Termination of Plan.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company shall have no obligation whatsoever to maintain the Plan or any Benefit
under the Plan for any given length of time. The Company reserves the right to terminate the Plan or any Benefit option under the Plan at any time. Upon termination or discontinuance of the Plan, all
elections with respect to the Plan shall terminate, and payments with respect to Benefits shall be made only with respect to claims incurred on or prior to the date of the Plan's termination. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="jq1031_article_vii_committee"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_jq1031_8"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>ARTICLE VII<BR>  COMMITTEE    <BR>    </I></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.01</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Committee.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Committee shall be responsible for the general administration of the Plan. In the absence of
the appointment of a Committee, the functions and powers of the Committee shall reside with the Company. The Committee shall establish regulations for the day to day administration of the Plan. The
Committee and its designated agents shall have the exclusive right and discretion to interpret the terms and conditions of the Plan and to decide all matters arising with respect to the Plan's
administration and operation (including factual issues). Any interpretations or decisions so made shall be conclusive and binding on all persons, subject to the claims procedures set forth in each
respective coverage document. The Committee or its designee may pay the expenses of administering the Plan or may reimburse the Company or other person performing administrative services with respect
to the Plan if the Company or such other person directly pays such expenses at the request of the Committee. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.02</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Authority to Appoint Advisors and Agents.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Committee may appoint and employ such persons as it may deem
advisable and as it may require in carrying out the provisions of the Plan. To the extent permitted by law, the members of the Committee shall be fully protected by any action taken in reliance upon
advice given by such persons and in reliance on tables, valuations, certificates, determinations, opinions and reports which are furnished by any accountant, counsel, claims administrator or other
expert who is employed or engaged by the Committee. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.03</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Compensation and Expenses of Committee.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The members of the Committee shall receive no compensation for its
duties hereunder, but the Committee shall be reimbursed for all reasonable and necessary expenses incurred in the performance of its duties, including counsel fees and expenses. Such expenses of the
Committee, including the compensation of administrators, actuaries, counsel, agents or others that the Committee may employ, shall be paid out of the general assets of the Company. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>5</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=6,EFW="2126594",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="12",CHK=1034637,FOLIO='5',FILE='DISK032:[04ATA1.04ATA1031]JQ1031A.;3',USER='CHANSON',CD='20-FEB-2004;19:59' -->
<A NAME="page_jq1031_1_6"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.04</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Records.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Committee shall keep or cause to be kept books and records with respect to the operations and
administration of this Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.05</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Indemnification of Committee.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company agrees to indemnify and to defend to the fullest extent permitted
by law any employee serving as a member of the Committee or as its delegate against all liabilities, damages, costs and expenses, including attorneys' fees and amounts paid in settlement of any claims
approved by the Company, occasioned by any act or failure to act in connection with the Plan, unless such act or omission arises out of such employee's gross negligence, willful neglect or willful
misconduct. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.06</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Fiduciary Responsibility Insurance, Bonding.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If the Company has not done so, the Committee may purchase
appropriate insurance on behalf of the Plan and the Plan's fiduciaries to cover liability or losses occurring by reason of the acts or omissions of a fiduciary; provided, however, that such insurance
to the extent purchased by the Plan must permit recourse by the insurer against the fiduciary in the case of a breach of a fiduciary duty or obligation by such fiduciary. The cost of such insurance
shall be paid out of the general assets of the Company. The Committee shall also obtain a bond covering all of the Plan's fiduciaries, to be paid from the general assets of the Company. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="jq1031_article_viii_miscellaneous_provisions"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_jq1031_9"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>ARTICLE VIII<BR>  MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS    <BR>    </I></B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.01</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Plan Is Not an Employment Contract.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Plan is not a contract of employment, and neither the Plan nor the
payment of any Benefits will be construed as giving to any person any legal or equitable right to employment by the Company. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.02</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Assignment.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If applicable, a Covered Person may authorize the Plan to directly pay the service provider or
hospital that provided the Covered Person's covered care and treatment. Except as provided in any insurance contract providing benefits under this Plan, the foregoing sentence, or as otherwise
provided in any a Covered Person may not assign or alienate any payment with respect to any Benefit which a Covered Person is entitled to receive from the Plan, and further, except as may be
prescribed by law, no Benefits shall be subject to attachment or garnishment of or for a Covered Person's debts or contracts, except for recovery of overpayments made on a Covered Person's behalf by
this Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.03</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Fraud.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No payments with respect to Benefits under this Plan will be paid if the Covered Person or the
provider of service attempts to perpetrate a fraud upon the Plan with respect to any such claim. The Plan Administrator shall have the right to make the final determination of whether a fraud has been
attempted or committed upon the Plan or if a misrepresentation of fact has been made, and its decision shall be final, conclusive and binding upon all persons. The Plan shall have the right to
terminate an otherwise Eligible Individual's eligibility hereunder, fully recover any amounts, with interest, improperly paid by the Plan by reason of fraud, attempted fraud or misrepresentation of
fact by a Covered Person or service provider and to pursue all other legal or equitable remedies. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.04</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Funding Status of Plan.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Benefits under the Plan may be self-funded or provided through one or
more insurance contracts selected and obtained by the Plan Administrator for that purpose, or any combination of the above. No Covered Person or other person shall have any claim against, right to, or
security or other interest in, any fund, account or asset of the Company from which any payment under the Plan may be made. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.05</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Construction.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Plan shall be construed, administered and enforced according to the laws of the State of
Georgia, except to the extent preempted by federal law. The headings and subheadings are set forth for convenient reference only and have no substantive effect whatsoever. All pronouns and all
variations thereof shall be deemed to refer to the masculine, feminine, neuter, singular or plural, as the identity of the person, persons or entity may require. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>6</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=7,EFW="2126594",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="12",CHK=681545,FOLIO='6',FILE='DISK032:[04ATA1.04ATA1031]JQ1031A.;3',USER='CHANSON',CD='20-FEB-2004;19:59' -->
<A NAME="page_jq1031_1_7"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.06</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Conclusiveness of Records.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The records of the Company with respect to age, employment history, illnesses
and all other relevant matters shall be conclusive for purposes of the administration of, and the resolution of claims arising under, the Plan. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.07</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Right to Require Information and Reliance Thereon.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company, Plan Administrator, and claims
administrator shall have the right to require any Covered Person to provide it and its agents with such information, in writing, and in such form as it may deem necessary to the administration of the
Plan and may rely on that information in carrying out its duties hereunder. Any payment to a Covered Person in accordance with the provisions of the Plan in good faith reliance upon any written
information provided by the Covered Person shall be in full satisfaction of all claims by the Covered Person. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.08</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Income Taxes.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Company contributions under the Plan, if any, will generally be taxable to Participants.
Except as otherwise may be provided in an individual agreement, the Participant shall bear the expense of any income tax required to be withheld from any Benefit payment. In the Plan Administrator's
discretion, the amount of any applicable tax may be deducted from the cash payment, or paid by the Covered Person in any other manner permitted by the Plan Administrator. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN
TESTIMONY WHEREOF, The Coca-Cola Company has caused this document to be signed by its duly authorized officer, to be effective as of December&nbsp;31, 2002. </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Medical
Benefits
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Dental
Benefits

Life Insurance (Active Board Members only)

Death and Dismemberment Insurance (Active Board Members only)

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=10,SEQ=10,EFW="2126594",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="12",CHK=768460,FOLIO='9',FILE='DISK032:[04ATA1.04ATA1031]JQ1031A.;3',USER='CHANSON',CD='20-FEB-2004;19:59' -->

<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 10.33.2
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>

</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#04ATA1030_13">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="js1031_exhibit_10.33.2"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_js1031_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit 10.33.2    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="js1031_amendment_number_one_to_the_co__ame03808"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_js1031_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>AMENDMENT NUMBER ONE TO<BR>  THE COCA-COLA COMPANY BENEFITS PLAN<BR>  FOR MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THIS AMENDMENT to The Coca-Cola Company Benefits Plan for Members of the Board of Directors (the "Plan") is adopted by The Coca-Cola
Company Benefits Committee (the "Committee"). </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="js1031_w_i_t_n_e_s_s_e_t_h_"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_js1031_3"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>W I T N E S S E T H:    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS, Section&nbsp;7.01 of the Plan provides that the Committee may amend the Plan at any time; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS,
the Committee wishes to amend the Plan to address the use and disclosure of protected health information. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NOW,
THEREFORE, the Committee hereby amends the Plan as follows: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective
April&nbsp;14, 2003, the following new Article&nbsp;IX shall be added: </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="js1031_article_ix_protected_health_information"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_js1031_4"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B><I>Article&nbsp;IX<BR>  Protected Health Information    <BR>    </I></B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Article&nbsp;IX is only applicable to medical, dental and employee assistance program benefits. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.01</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Use and Disclosure of Protected Health Information.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
Plan will use and disclose protected health information (PHI) for purposes related to the treatment through, payment for, and operation of health care functions. The Plan will
disclose PHI to the Company only after receipt of proper confirmation from the Company that the Plan document has been amended to incorporate the following provisions and/or conditions relating to the
use and disclosure of PHI. </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Payment</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;for health care functions includes those activities undertaken by or performed on behalf of the
Plan to obtain premiums or to determine or fulfill its responsibility for coverage and provision of benefits under the Plan with respect to an individual to whom health care services are provided.
Activities that constitute payment activities include, but are not limited to, the following activities: </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Determination
of eligibility or coverage (including the determination of cost sharing amounts);
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Coordination
of benefits;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Adjudication
or subrogation of health benefit claims;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Risk
adjusting amounts due based upon enrollee health status and demographic characteristics;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Billing,
claims management, collection activities, obtaining payment under a contract for reinsurance (including stop-loss insurance and excess of loss insurance), and
related health care data processing;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>6.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Review
of health care services with respect to medical necessity, coverage under a health plan, appropriateness of care, or justification of charges;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>7.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Utilization
review activities, including precertification and preauthorization of services, concurrent and retrospective review of services; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>8.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Disclosure
to consumer reporting agencies of any of the following health information relating to collection of premiums or reimbursement:
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(i)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Name
and address; </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
</UL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2126594",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="13",CHK=353394,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK032:[04ATA1.04ATA1031]JS1031A.;4',USER='YLEE',CD='23-FEB-2004;19:24' -->
<UL>
<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(ii)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Date
of birth;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(iii)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Social
Security Number;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(iv)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Payment
history;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(v)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Account
number; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(vi)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Name
and address of the health care provider and/or health plan. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Health Care Operations</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;include, but are not limited to, the following activities: </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Conducting
quality assessment and improvement activities, including outcomes evaluation and development of clinical guidelines (provided that the obtainment of generalizable knowledge
is not the primary purpose of any studies resulting from such activities);
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Population-based
activities relating to the improving health or reducing health care costs, protocol development, case management and care coordination, and contacting of health care
providers and patients with information about treatment alternatives (and related functions that do not include treatment);
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Reviewing
the competence or qualifications of health care professionals, evaluating practitioner and provider performance, health plan performance, conducting training programs for
students, trainees, or practitioners in areas of health care, and training of non-health care professionals;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Accreditation,
certification, licensing, or credentialing activities;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Underwriting,
premium rating, and other activities relating to the creation, renewal or replacement of a contract of health insurance or health benefits, and ceding, securing, or
placing a contract for reinsurance of risk relating to claims for health care (including stop-loss insurance and excess of loss insurance);
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>6.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Conducting
or arranging for medical review, legal services, and auditing functions (including fraud and abuse detection and compliance programs);
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>7.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Business
planning and development, such as conducting cost- management and planning-related analyses related to managing and operating the Plan, including formulary
development and administration, development or improvement of methods of payment or coverage policies;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>8.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Business
management and general administrative activities of the Plan, including (but not limited to):
<BR><BR></FONT>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(i)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Management
activities relating to implementation of and compliance with the requirements of HIPAA's administrative simplification regulations;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(ii)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Customer
service, including the provision of data analyses for policy holders or other customers (provided that protected health information is not disclosed to such
policy holder or customer);
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(iii)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Resolution
of internal grievances;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(iv)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Due
diligence in connection with the sale or transfer of assets to a potential successor in interest (if the potential successor in interest is a covered entity under
HIPAA or will become a covered entity following the sale or transfer); and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(v)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Creating
de-identified health information, fundraising for the benefit of the covered entity, and marketing for which an individual authorization is not
required. </FONT></DD></DL>
</DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.02</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Use and Disclosure of PHI as Required by Law or as Permitted by Authorization of the Participant or
Beneficiary.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;With authorization, the Plan will disclose PHI to the other plans sponsored by the Company for purposes related to administration of these plans. </FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2126594",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="13",CHK=133964,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK032:[04ATA1.04ATA1031]JS1031A.;4',USER='YLEE',CD='23-FEB-2004;19:24' -->
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.03</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Conditions relating to the Use and Disclosure of PHI by the Company the Company agree to the following conditions relating to the use and
disclosure of PHI:</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(a)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
Company will not use or further disclose PHI other than as permitted or required by the Plan document or required by law;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(b)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
Company will ensure that any agents, including subcontractors, to whom it provides PHI received from the Plan agree to the same restrictions and conditions that apply to the
Company with respect to such PHI;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(c)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
Company will not use or disclose PHI for employment-related actions or decisions or in connection with any other benefit or employee benefit plan of the Company (unless authorized
to do so by the individual);
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(d)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
Company will report to the Plan any use or disclosure of PHI that is inconsistent with the uses or disclosures provided for in the Plan document of which the Company becomes
aware;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(e)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
Company will make PHI available to the individual in accordance with the access requirements of HIPAA;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(f)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
Company will make PHI available to the individual for amendment and incorporate any amendments to PHI in accordance the amendment requirements of HIPAA;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(g)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
Company will make available such information as is required to provide an accounting of disclosures in accordance with the requirements of HIPAA;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(h)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
Company will make its internal practices, books, and records relating to the use and disclosure of PHI received from the Plan available to the Secretary of Health and Human
Services for purposes of determining compliance by the Plan with the requirements of HIPAA;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(i)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
Company will, if feasible, return or destroy all PHI received from the Plan that the Company still maintains in any form and retain no copies of such PHI when no longer needed for
the purpose for which the disclosure was made. Where such return or destruction is not feasible, the Company will limit further uses or disclosures to those purposes that make the return or
destruction of the PHI infeasible. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.04</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Establishment and Maintenance of Adequate Separation between the Company.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In accordance with the
requirements of HIPAA, only the following employees/classes of employees will be given access to PHI to be disclosed: </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><TABLE WIDTH="74%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
persons described above will only have access to and use PHI for purposes of Plan administration functions that the Company performs for the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.05</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Noncompliance by Plan Administrative Personnel:</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event that the employee/class of employees described
in subsection 9.04 above fail to comply with the terms of the Plan document, the Company shall provide an effective mechanism for the resolution of any such noncompliance issues, to include
disciplinary measures. </FONT></P>

<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, the Committee has adopted this Amendment on the date shown below, but effective as of the dates indicated above. </FONT></P>

<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 10.33.3
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>

</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#04ATA1030_14">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ju1031_exhibit_10.33.3"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ju1031_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit 10.33.3    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ju1031_amendment_number_two_to_the_co__ame03832"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ju1031_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>AMENDMENT NUMBER TWO TO<BR>  THE COCA-COLA COMPANY BENEFITS PLAN<BR>  FOR MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;THIS AMENDMENT to The Coca-Cola Company Benefits Plan for Members of the Board of Directors (the "Plan") is adopted by The Coca-Cola
Company Benefits Committee (the "Committee"). </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ju1031_w_i_t_n_e_s_s_e_t_h_"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ju1031_3"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>W I T N E S S E T H:    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS, the Plan was previously amended by instrument dated April&nbsp;15, 2003 in order to address the use and disclosure of protected health information; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS,
Section&nbsp;6.01 of the Plan provides that the Committee may amend the Plan at any time; and </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;WHEREAS,
the Committee wishes to amend the Plan in order to correct a typographical error and to clarify certain information that is not considered to be protected health information. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NOW,
THEREFORE, the Committee hereby amends the Plan as follows, effective as of the dates specified herein: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I> Effective December&nbsp;31, 2002:  </I></B></FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Article&nbsp;II shall be amended by inserting "The Coca-Cola Company" immediately before "Benefits Committee" in the first sentence of the
definition of "Committee." </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B><I> Effective August&nbsp;15, 2003:  </I></B></FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Article&nbsp;IX, which was incorporated into the Plan by Amendment Number One, shall be amended as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Section&nbsp;9.01
shall be amended by adding the following sentence to the end of the first paragraph: </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>"Notwithstanding
any provision to the contrary, PHI shall not include enrollment/disenrollment information or summary health information disclosed to the Company by the Plan (or a business associate,
health insurance issuer or HMO on behalf of the Plan)." </FONT></P>

</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Section&nbsp;9.02
shall be amended by adding the following sentence to the end of the section: </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>"The
Plan will disclose PHI to other entities without authorization from a participant or beneficiary if such disclosure is required by law." </FONT></P>

</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Section&nbsp;9.03
shall be amended to correct a typographical error by separating the inadvertently combined title and first sentence to read as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;"9.03</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Conditions Relating to the Use and Disclosure of PHI by the Company.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company agrees to the following
conditions relating to the use and disclosure of PHI:" </FONT></P>

</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Subsection
9.03(f) shall be amended by inserting the word "with" between the phrases "...PHI in accordance" and "the amendment..."
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>5.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Section&nbsp;9.04
shall be amended by (i)&nbsp;correcting the title to read "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Establishment and Maintenance of Adequate Separation between the Company and
Plan,</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" (ii)&nbsp;changing the name "Ann Kroboth" to "Ann Cegielski," (iii)&nbsp;deleting the names "Sandy Lewis" and "Lisa Bremmer," and (iv)&nbsp;inserting the names
"Beverly Friez," "Debra Davis," "Angela Coppola," "Linda Hodges," "Flo Lue" and "Miatta Wright." </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2126594",CP="THE COCA-COLA COMPANY",DN="14",CHK=392463,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK032:[04ATA1.04ATA1031]JU1031A.;4',USER='YLEE',CD='23-FEB-2004;19:24' -->
<UL>
<UL>
</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, the Committee has adopted this Amendment Number Two on the date shown below, but effective as of the dates indicated above. </FONT></P>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-12.1
<SEQUENCE>16
<FILENAME>a2126594zex-12_1.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 12.1
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>

</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#04ATA1030_15">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kj1031_exhibit_12.1"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kj1031_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 12.1    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kj1031_the_coca-cola_company_and_subs__the04559"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kj1031_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>The Coca-Cola Company and Subsidiaries<BR>  Computation of Ratios of Earnings to Fixed Charges<BR>  </B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>(IN MILLIONS EXCEPT RATIOS)    <BR></FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="93%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TH COLSPAN=3 ALIGN="LEFT"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT><BR></TH>
<TH WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH COLSPAN=14 ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Year Ended December 31,</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TH COLSPAN=3 ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT><BR></TH>
<TH WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH COLSPAN=2 ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=1><B>2003</B></FONT><BR></TH>
<TH WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH COLSPAN=2 ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=1><B>2002</B></FONT><BR></TH>
<TH WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH COLSPAN=2 ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=1><B>2001</B></FONT><BR></TH>
<TH WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH COLSPAN=2 ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=1><B>2000</B></FONT><BR></TH>
<TH WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH COLSPAN=2 ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=1><B>1999</B></FONT><BR></TH>
<TH WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TH COLSPAN=18 ALIGN="CENTER"><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD COLSPAN=3><FONT SIZE=2>Earnings:</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
Company is contingently liable for guarantees of indebtedness owed by third parties in the amount of $280&nbsp;million. Fixed charges for these contingent liabilities have not been included in
the computation of the above ratios as the amounts are immaterial and, in the opinion of Management, it is not probable that the Company will be required to satisfy the guarantees. </FONT></P>

<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit&nbsp;23.1  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="km1031_consent_of_independent_auditors"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_km1031_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>CONSENT OF INDEPENDENT AUDITORS    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We consent to the incorporation by reference in the registration statements and related prospectuses of The Coca-Cola Company listed below of our
report dated February&nbsp;9, 2004, with respect to the consolidated financial statements and schedule of The Coca-Cola Company included in this Annual Report on
Form&nbsp;10-K for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2003: </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><TABLE WIDTH="71%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT SIZE=2>Registration Statement Number 2-88085 on Form&nbsp;S-8</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT SIZE=2>Registration Statement Number 33-39840 on Form&nbsp;S-8</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="92%"><FONT SIZE=2>Registration Statement Number 333-78763 on Form&nbsp;S-8</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ko1031_exhibit_24.1"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ko1031_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 24.1    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ko1031_power_of_attorney"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ko1031_2"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>POWER OF ATTORNEY    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;KNOW ALL BY THESE PRESENTS THAT I, DOUGLAS&nbsp;N. DAFT, Chairman of the Board, Chief Executive Officer and a Director of The Coca-Cola Company (the
"Company"), do hereby appoint STEVEN&nbsp;J. HEYER, President and Chief Operating Officer of the Company, GARY&nbsp;P. FAYARD, Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of the Company,
DEVAL&nbsp;L. PATRICK, Executive Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary of the Company and CAROL&nbsp;C. HAYES, Assistant Secretary of the Company, or any one of them, my true and lawful
attorneys-in-fact for me and in my name for the purpose of executing on my behalf in any and all capacities the Company's Annual Report for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2003 on Form&nbsp;10-K, or any amendment or supplement thereto, and causing such Annual Report or any such amendment or supplement to be filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission
pursuant to the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, I have hereunto set my hand this 19th&nbsp;day of February&nbsp;2004. </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="47%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="50%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
/s/&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>DOUGLAS N. DAFT</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><HR NOSHADE><FONT SIZE=2> Chairman of the Board,<BR>
Chief Executive Officer and Director<BR>
The Coca-Cola Company</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
